com.example.messagesiphon

Class Conversation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.messagesiphon.Conversation

  • public class Conversation
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this class is to hold all data in a particular Facebook conversation between two or more people. It also loads its messages using a Facebook session and FQL requests.
    Author:
    Tom

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Conversation(JSONObject conversationJSON)
      This creates a conversation object that holds all of the information in a Facebook conversation between two or more users.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Conversation

        public Conversation(JSONObject conversationJSON)
        This creates a conversation object that holds all of the information in a Facebook conversation between two or more users.
        Parameters:
        conversationJSON - either the FQL JSON results or previously loaded conversation JSON object

    • Method Detail

      • loadMessages

        public void loadMessages(java.util.GregorianCalendar lastUpdatedTime,
                com.facebook.Session session,
                boolean restrictToOneMonthBack)
        This method is used to collect all of the messages for a conversation. It does this using an FQL query. It collects 40 messages, then changes the offset by 40, gets 40 more, and so on until all messages are collected. 40 was chosen because it is the largest number that FQL respects concerning FQL queries. Even if a number like 50 or 60 is used, only 40 results are returned.
        Parameters:
        lastUpdatedTime - The time object that this conversation was last updated. It is passed in if this conversation was previously on record, otherwise it is null.
        session - The Facebook session used to send an FQL query
        restrictToOneMonthBack - If set to true the query will stop if the message timestamps are more than a month old.
